definition: variant of 紅運|红运[hong2 yun4]

sentences.english: Wherever Alfred goes he is sure to find his bread buttered on both sides.
sentences.chinese: 不管到什么地方去，艾尔弗雷德总是鸿运高照。

sentences.english: I hope your new dewelling will bring you and your family loads offortune and good health.
sentences.chinese: 谨祝你的新居将为你全家带来鸿运。

sentences.english: " Lucky Strike " is a blue-blooded Mongorian.
sentences.chinese: “鸿运当头”是一匹纯种的蒙古马。

sentences.english: Thank you for your stay at the Hongyun Hotel.
sentences.chinese: 感谢阁下入住鸿运大酒店。

sentences.english: I hope your new dwelling will bring you and yours lots of fortune and good health.
sentences.chinese: 希望你的新居为你及家人带来鸿运和安康。

definition: profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
lit. (may the) five blessings descend upon this home (namely: longevity, wealth, health, virtue, and a natural death)/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
lucky star in the ascendant (idiom); a lucky sign
to accept a life of ease/to enjoy a comfortable retirement
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
lit. gold and jade fill the hall (idiom)/fig. abundant wealth/abundance of knowledge
to add a son to the family
to arrive home/facing one's home/home-coming/(soccer) facing the goalmouth
ushering in wealth and prosperity (idiom and traditional greeting, esp. at New Year); We wish you wealth and success!
